bug.author: sooheon
bug.summary: Repeatedly logging confusion matrix results in overlapping numbers
bug.description:
wandb --version && python --version && uname
Weights and Biases version: wandb, version 0.9.3 Python version: Python 3.7.6 Operating System: Linux
<denchmark-h:h3>Description</denchmark-h>
What I want: log confusion matrix for multiclass predictions on the validation set after every epoch, and have them logged separately so I can flip through them What happened: The numbers come up overlapped on a single plot: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/302945/87299187-85b78180-c546-11ea-9e84-91af45154e7c.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h3>What I Did</denchmark-h>
I'm using it through the pytorch-lightning API. The validation_epoch_end method returns <denchmark-code>{ 'log': {'val_loss': mean_losses, 'confusion_matrix': confusion_matrix(y, pred, atom_syms)}} </denchmark-code>
and the 'log' key is simply logged via the wandb run object. confusion_matrix is from wandb.sklearn.
